episodes.title: S02 E01 Lets Talk About Sex (baby)
episodes.description: The team are back for Season 2 of the friendly discussion about all things high control, Jehovah's Witness and cult. In this episode Steph and Louise wildly overshare and Adam maintains the decorum you have come to expect from the podcast. We discuss the extreme control around relationships and sex, why Jehovah's Witnesses marry so young, the consequences of committing 'sins' and some of the damage this does to peoples' long term prospects for healthy relationships in the future. To contact us please email: askingforafriendquestions@outlook.com We will respect your anonymity. episodes.title: S01E13 Additional Education
episodes.description: Steph, Adam and Louise are pissed, and not in the Rutherford sense. In this episode we discuss the shocking 'clarification of understanding' that now allows Jehovah's Witnesses to get an education beyond basic compulsory schooling. After decades of young JWs having to scratch a living with bare minimum jobs that do not require any additional education, suddenly the Governing Body has discovered that Galatians 6:5 means people can go to college and university.We discuss the implications, reasons and ruined lives. Resources supporting this podcast: Pew Research: https://www.pewresearch.org/short-reads/2016/10/11/how-income-varies-among-u-s-religious-groups/ Religion Watch: https://www.religionwatch.com/jehovahs-witnesses-educational-and-professional-deficit/ Educational Attainment by sex and religion in the United States: https://paa2019.populationassociation.org/uploads/190745 Jehovahs Witnesses and Higher Education: https://jw.support/blog/2019/12/02/jehovahs-witnesses-and-higher-education/ To contact us please email: askingforafriendquestions@outlook.com We will respect your anonymity. episodes.title: S01E12 Rutherford. Wine, Women and Hitler
episodes.description: Louise, Steph and Adam discuss the life and influences of Joseph Rutherford, second president of the Watchtower Society. We discuss his simmering anger and the things he banned, the four women he summoned with a whistle, his relationship with his personal assistant Berta, his wealth and alcoholism that led him to move away from Bethel to his vanity project Beth Sarim. We also learn about his hatred of the Jews and his love of Hitler which turned sour and led to the death of over 1000 faithful Jehovah's Witnesses. We also manage to fit in some discussion of his hatred of beards, women, Mother's Day and prohibition. References: 'The Four Presidents of the Watchtower' by Edmond C Gruss. https://www.amazon.co.uk/Presidents-Watch-Society-Jehovahs-Witnesses/dp/1594671311 Photo of Christmas celebration at Brooklyn Bethel: https://www.reddit.com/r/exjw/comments/zu71me/the_last_time_christmas_was_celebrated_at/ Evidence of Nazi Flags at Rutherford's Berlin convention: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xdJEvw9pdAc To contact us please mail: askingforafriendquestions@outlook.com We will respect your anonymity. episodes.title: S01E11 Ozzy and The Sisters
episodes.description: Adam, Steph and Louise discuss the JW presence at Ozzy Osbourne's funeral procession through Birmingham, the role of the sisters, and a walk down memory lane discussing the Thursday meeting. An entertaining discussion about the carts compared to the perils of olden day field service, the role of the sisters and their legendary cleaning and catering skills, and then Adam gives us a detailed run down of what the Thursday meeting used to be like before the format radically changed into its current iteration. episodes.title: S01E10 Stand Up The real Charles Russell
episodes.description: Steph, Adam and Louise take a deep dive into the childhood, life, business, finances, affairs and influences that made the man who made a modern day cult. episodes.title: The Real Reason
episodes.description: Have you ever wondered why things have changed? Was the light really getting brighter or were there other more practical reasons for changes? Louise, Adam and Stephanie each take one change to the doctrine or practice of Jehovah's Witnesses and discuss what the real reasons behind the changes might have been. The sound is not great, but the subject matter is fascinating. Adam looks at why the elders arrangement has been changed recently to allow men as young as 21 to become elders in congregations of Jehovah's Witnesses. Stephanie discusses why the book study meeting held in peoples home was removed and the team speculate as to the reasons behind the change. Louise discusses the court case that preceded the literature changing from having a fixed price printed on the covers, to being offered to householders for 'free', albeit it with strong encouragement to make a donation. Please contact us on askingforafriendquestions@outlook.com We will respect your anonymity. Music: 'You're Not Who You Say You Are' by Ancient Modesto, Written by Simon Endeacott, Produced by Ian David c Four Monkeys Records

episodes.title: From Faith to Love. Being a Gay Jehovah's Witness
episodes.description: Adam and Louise interview Steph who was born into the Jehovah's Witnesses but knew she was gay from the age of 4. Steph lays out the most personal and intimate details of her life, her abuse and her coming out in this raw podcast. This interview also discusses domestic violence within Jehovah's Witnesses, emotional and physical abuse, and safeguarding issues.In this podcast we also learn that Adam may well have been an insufferable elder if he had remained. And we find out that Louise's Youtube videos made people think she was a bad bitch. Its possible that only Steph comes out of this interview unscathed. Please contact us on askingforafriendquestions@outlook.com We will respect your anonymity. Music: 'You're Not Who You Say You Are' by Ancient Modesto, Written by Simon Endeacott, Produced by Ian David c Four Monkeys Records

episodes.title: Government Inquiries
episodes.description: Louise and Adam discuss the latest government to announce an Inquiry into child sexual abuse and also review the previous Inquiries in several countries. We discuss the remit of the inquiries, the recommendations of the Inquiries that have published final reports and the response from Governments and the Jehovah's Witness organisation. Please contact us on askingforafriendquestions@outlook.com We will respect your anonymity. episodes.title: Modern Slavery
episodes.description: Adam and Louise interview their first guest, Lara Kaput and discuss whether the free work provided by Jehovah's Witnesses meets the legal definition of Modern Slavery. This incredibly interesting topic should be of interest to all Jehovah's Witnesses who may not realise that they are compelling people through the threat of disfellowshipping and shunning to provide significant amounts of free labour that turn into enormous financial benefit for the society. Please contact us on askingforafriendquestions@outlook.com We will respect your anonymity. episodes.title: The Greater Number Cooling Off
episodes.description: Adam and Louise discuss the figures in the 2024 Yearbook and what the trends show. There are some very interesting facts about the numbers of kingdom halls reducing, and the numbers pioneers in some countries, and how effective they are. Adam highlights how much of the worlds population lives in countries where Jehovah's Witnesses are banned and how this counters the narrative that every person will have a chance to convert before Armageddon. Adam has a little gem of information from the latest letter to congregations, that might have a huge implication for a future discussion around child labour, Child Labour laws and modern slavery as defined by the Modern Slavery Act 2015. We reference Paul Grundy's website, https://jwfacts.com/ and also https://avoidjw.org/ where you can get past issues of the Yearbook that are no longer available on the official JW website. To contact us please email: askingforafriendquestions@outlook.com We will respect your anonymity. Music: 'You're Not Who You Say You Are' by Ancient Modesto, Written by Simon Endeacott, Produced by Ian David c Four Monkeys Records

episodes.title: What to do About Christmas
episodes.description: Louise and Adam discuss how difficult navigating Christmas is when you are questioning, leaving or have just left Jehovah's Witnesses. They have some suggestions for navigating the guilt and awkwardness, picking and choosing the bits you like or doing something completely different. Adam reviews the history of Christmas within the Jehovah's Witnesses and how the doctrine has changed over time. We also find out what Adam did with his Advent Cheese. Adam discusses a recent Letter to Congregations regarding defibrillators. You can contact us at: askingforafriendquestions@outlook.com Your anonymity will be respected. We would love to hear any questions, comments or personal stories. Here is a link to the Elders Textbook Adam discusses in the show: https://avoidjw.org/manuals/elders-textbooks/ Music: 'You're Not Who You Say You Are' by Ancient Modesto, Written by Simon Endeacott, Produced by Ian David c Four Monkeys Records

episodes.title: Asking For a Friend Why Did The Music Change
episodes.description: Louise and Adam discuss in a respectful and balanced way some of the questions people in high control groups might wonder about but not dare ask. In this first episode they introduce themselves, discuss the genesis of the show, and discuss the question that first got Adam thinking, why did the music change?
